result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey W Person in court with attorney John William Campion.  Defendant Jeffrey W Person is in custody. Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State files amended information in 12CF566. Defense acknowledges receipt of same and enters NG plea. Upon plea to Cts 1 & 2, the State will DRI 14CF1695. The State will follow PSI.
P-G to both
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jeffrey W Person in court with attorney John William Campion.  Defendant Jeffrey W Person in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
State has submitted an offer and defens asks for COP ASAP  Plea hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Atty Popken moves to withdraw; Atty Campion has been retained.  BTC: withdrawal granted
Defendant in custody on other charges.  Poster requesting return of cash posted in this file.  BTC:  Granted, bond reissued at same amount and conditions as previously set.

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on February 16, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Jeffrey W Person in court with attorney Pamela L. Popken.  Defendant Jeffrey W Person in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the co-defendant MM, DP. No contact with 1605 Packard Ave.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jeffrey W Person in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Jeffrey W Person in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
